abstract: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is considering whether data recorders similar to those on planes should be required on all new cars and trucks.
snippet: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration is considering whether data recorders similar to those on planes should be required on all new cars and trucks.
lead_paragraph: DETROIT — Federal safety regulators, who allowed auto companies to voluntarily install event data recorders on their vehicles a few years ago, are now looking into whether the systems should be required, the head of the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday.

headline.main: Agency Weighs the Need for a ‘Black Box’ in Cars
headline.print_headline: Agency Weighs the Need For a ‘Black Box’ in Cars
